attributes.action: Put into place a legislative means for the electorate to initiate a vote of "no confidence" in the Government
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned believe there should be a legislative means where the electorate are able to initiate a vote of "no confidence" in the majority Government.

Should the majority of votes show a lack of confidence in the Government then a General Election should be called within an agreed (and reasonable) timescale of the completition of the count.

There should also be a means put in place (via public service announcements on major TV and radio news services) to publicise the voting.

Obviously the voting should be carried out via the Electrol Register in an attempt to ensure fairness.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
